title: Google just announced its new flagship phone, the $800 Pixel 4
text:
Google on Tuesday unveiled its new flagship smartphone, the Pixel 4.

The Pixel 4 phones have a design that harks back to the Pixel 2, except for a revamped rear camera.

It will come in two sizes — standard and XL — and three colors: black, white, or a limited-edition bright orange.

The Pixel 4 starts at $799, and the Pixel 4 XL starts at $899. It's available to preorder on Tuesday and will be widely available on October 24.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

With the countless leaks in the past few weeks, you might have thought Google had already announced its new Pixel 4 and Pixel 4 XL flagship smartphones, but the company made the phones official and filled in all the missing details at its big "Made by Google" event on Tuesday.

Combined with Google's own teasers, the incessant leaks, which ranged from high-resolution photos to full video reviews from Vietnamese tech YouTubers, left very little room for surprises.

Regardless, there's nothing like fully confirmed and official details, so here's everything you need to know about Google's Pixel 4 smartphones.

The Pixel 4 phones have a design that harks back to the Pixel 2, with a large top bezel "forehead." That forehead is where Google is storing its "Soli" advanced radar-based facial-recognition tech that can scan your face faster than any other phone, Google said.

The Soli sensors can also be used for motion-gesture controls for a limited number of apps, at least for now. So far, supported controls include skipping songs, snoozing alarms, and silencing phone calls by waving your hands.

The Pixel 4 phones have smooth and fluid 90Hz screens. On other phones with those screens, like the OnePlus 7-series smartphones, it gives the impression that the phone is faster and more powerful.

The Pixel 4 phones have a dual-lens camera system: one lens for regular photos, and another for zoomed photos.

Google made plenty of improvements to its Pixel cameras with the new live HDR plus, "learning" white balance, and wider range for portrait modes, and it made further improvements to the already incredible Night Sight mode.

Google Assistant got a "clean, new interface," Google said, and looks sleeker and more integrated with the phone — like it's part of the Pixel 4 rather than a separate entity.

The Pixel 4 starts at $799, and the Pixel 4 XL starts at $899. The device will come in three colors: black, white, or a limited-edition bright orange. It's available to preorder on Tuesday and will be widely available on October 24.
description: The Pixel 4 might be the most leaked smartphone in history, but nothing beats official and confirmed details. Check out Google's new smartphones.
